newsitem.title: JAPAN: Foreign investment in Japan markets in Jan - JSDA.
newsitem.headline: Foreign investment in Japan markets in Jan - JSDA.

text.p: Investment by non-residents in Japanese capital markets for January, region by region and in billions of yen, were as follows, the Japan Securities Dealers' Association (JSDA) said on Tuesday.
"Region" refers to the nationality of investors. The section marked "others" includes investors in the Middle East, Latin America, Africa and Oceania, the JSDA said.

Yen bonds cover government and corporate debt with maturities of more than one year and include yen-denominated bonds issued in Japan by non-residents of Japan (samurai bonds), warrant bonds and bank debentures, but exclude dual-currency bonds and Euroyen bonds, the JSDA said.
Figures are given on a delivery basis and may not tally due to rounding.
